com.wolvencraft.yasp.db.data.sync

Class DeathsData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wolvencraft.yasp.db.data.sync.DeathsData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataStore

    public class DeathsData
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataStore
    Data collector that records all item statistics on the server for a specific player.
    Author:
    bitWolfy

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DeathsData.DetailedDeathEntry
      Represents an entry in the Detailed data store.
      class  DeathsData.TotalDeathsEntry
      Represents the total number of times a player died of a particular cause.
      Each entry must have a unique player and a unique death cause.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.wolvencraft.yasp.db.data.sync.DataStore

        DataStore.DetailedData, DataStore.NormalData

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeathsData(int playerId)
      Default constructor
      Creates an empty data store to save the statistics until database synchronization.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dump()
      Clears the data store of all locally stored data.
      java.util.List<DataStore.DetailedData> getDetailedData()
      Returns the static entries in the data store.
      java.util.List<DataStore.NormalData> getNormalData()
      Returns the dynamic entries in the data store.
      Asynchronous method; changes to the returned List will not affect the data store.
      DeathsData.TotalDeathsEntry getNormalData(org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDamageEvent.DamageCause cause)
      Returns the specific entry from the data store.
      If the entry does not exist, it will be created.
      void playerDied(org.bukkit.Location location, org.bukkit.event.entity.EntityDamageEvent.DamageCause cause)
      Registers the player death in the data store
      void sync()
      Synchronizes the data from the data store to the database, then removes it from local storage
      If an entry was not synchronized, it will not be removed.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
